contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=UK |Ship flag=[[Image:British-Royal-Fleet-Auxiliary-Ensign.svg|60px|RFA Ensign]] |Ship name=RFA ''Surf Pioneer'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Bartram & Sons]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=23 April 1951 |Ship acquired=14 July 1951 |Ship completed= |Ship commissioned=28 November 1951 |Ship decommissioned=13 August 1960 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Arrived at [[Burriana]] for scrapping on 28 February 1970 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Surf class tanker|Surf class]] [[oil tanker|tanker]] |Ship tonnage= |Ship displacement=15,800 [[tonne]]s full load |Ship length={{convert|469|ft|6|in|m|2|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|60|ft|6|in|m|2|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{convert|27|ft|3.75|in|m|2|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=1 x 4 cyl Doxford diesel<br>Single shaft<br>{{convert|4250|bhp|kW|abbr=on}} |Ship speed={{convert|12.5|kn|km/h}} |Ship range= |Ship complement= |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament= |Ship armour= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} '''RFA ''Surf Pioneer'' (A365)''' was a [[Surf class tanker|Surf-class]] freighting [[oil tanker|tanker]] of the [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]]. She and her sister [[RFA Surf Patrol (A357)|RFA ''Surf Patrol'']] were originally ordered by Polish owners but were commandeered by the [[Admiralty]] whilst building during the [[Korean War]]. She was launched on 23 April 1951 as ''Beskidy'', and was purchased by the Royal Fleet Auxiliary on 14 July 1951. She was decommissioned on 13 August 1960 and laid up at [[HMNB Devonport|Devonport]]. She arrived at [[Burriana]] for scrapping on 28 February 1970. ==References== *{{cite book |first=J.J.|last=Colledge |authorlink=J. J. Colledge|title=[[Ships of the Royal Navy]]: An Historical Index Volume 2: Navy-built Trawlers, Drifters, Tugs and Requisitioned Ships|publisher=David & Charles|location=Newton Abbot}} {{Surf class tanker}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Surf Pioneer}} [[Category:Surf-class tankers]] [[Category:Tankers of the Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] [[Category:1951 ships]] {{UK-aux-ship-stub}}
